articles.description: Graham Potter says West Ham's display at Aston Villa gave him "encouragement" - even if his pre-match "excitement" was short lived.
articles.title: West Ham United: Positives for Graham Potter after Aston Villa FA Cup defeat

articles.description: David Moyes is in talks with Everton over a possible return to the Toffees as manager following Sean Dyche's sacking.
articles.title: Moyes in talks with Everton over return to club

articles.description: Glasgow Warriors book their spot in the knockout stages of the Champions Cup with a clinical destruction of Racing 92 at Scotstoun.
articles.title: Glasgow Warriors 29-19 Racing 92: Hosts book spot in Champions Cup knockout stage

articles.description: Manchester City agree £33.6m deal with Lens for Uzbekistan central defender Abdukodir Khusanov.
articles.title: Abdukodir Khusanov: Manchester City agree £33.6m deal for Lens defender

articles.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan, the defending champion, will miss the Masters in London on medical grounds.
articles.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan: Defending champion withdraws from Masters

articles.description: Players to watch, how to follow and England's chances - here's all you need to know as Heather Knight's side look to win the Ashes for the first time since 2014.
articles.title: Women's Ashes 2025: Heather Knight and England seek history after more than a decade

articles.description: Manchester United and Portugal full-back Diogo Dalot speaks to BBC Sport's Betty Glover about new manager Ruben Amorim and the difference he's brought to the team.
articles.title: Diogo Dalot reveals changes under Ruben Amorim at Man Utd

articles.description: Lifelong Liverpool fan Josh Woods was at Anfield to watch them beat Bayer Leverkusen in the Champions League in November - now he's about to face them in the FA Cup.
articles.title: FA Cup: Liverpool fan Josh Woods ready to play against the Reds for Accrington

articles.description: Italian Jannik Sinner's doping case will be heard at the Court of Arbitration for Sport from 16-17 April 2025.
articles.title: Jannik Sinner: Italian's doping case to be heard at Court of Arbitration for Sport in April 2025

articles.description: Rugby Football Union chief executive Bill Sweeney's future will be voted on by rugby clubs across England after his critics forced the governing body to call a crisis summit.
articles.title: Bill Sweeney: Rebels force RFU vote on under-fire chief executive
